name: Glazed Doughnut Bacon Egg Cheeseburgers
description: Because cheeseburgers are awesome and doughnuts are awesome, Chris Zelenak submitted this glazed doughnut bacon egg cheeseburger recipe to us. Read more about it on A Hamburger Today or go straight to the recipe!...
recipeYield: about three burgers per pound of beef
recipeIngredient: One egg per patty, fried, as a burger topping  (note: for egg-in-a-hat style you'll need to carve out some extra space in the doughnut, but it fries pretty well)
Maple Syrup (1/2 cup per pound beef)
Kosher Salt (approx 1 tablespoon per pound beef)
Fresh Basil (1/2 cup per pound beef)
Full egg (1 per pound beef); this will be mixed in with the beef, not fried as the egg above

recipeInstructions.text: Mix all together with beef to form patties. I was in a rush to get all this done in the lunch hour, but when I make burgers normally I also try to save some kosher salt to coat the outside of the burger, so that it will form a crispy / salty crust (I say crust, but it's barely noticeable—I do it more for the idea, I think) on the outside.

For the doughnuts, I shaved off the top part of each doughnut to allow for an easier grilling time for myself, as well as a less messy experience eating the burger. That was my hope, at least, though after all is said and done, this much shit on a burger is gonna be messy regardless.
